---
title: I have a Ranger player
categories: Base Classes
tags: ['ranger', 'player', 'continually', 'forgets']

I have a Ranger player who continually forgets about his animal companion. I think he&#39;d just prefer to play without one. Has anyone made a Ranger playbook/build that doesn&#39;t integrate an animal companion?
<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110973090768429200038_photo.jpg'> Marshall Brengle</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-04-21 17:50:02 (edited: 2018-04-21 17:50:02)</cite></p>
        <p>Pretty sure Awful Good Games has one...<br /><br /><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/117134143142507309944" oid="117134143142507309944">David Guyll</a></span> could confirm</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>

</div>

</div>
        

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/108131264929529993281_photo.jpg'> Lester Ward</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-04-21 20:22:29 (edited: 2018-04-21 20:22:29)</cite></p>
        <p>What do you consider “ranger-y”, sans animal companion? Archer guy? Tracker?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107314641573753618291_photo.jpg'> Robin Irwin</h4>

</div>
        

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/100990726871994245256_photo.jpg'> Mattia Bulgarelli</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-04-21 23:17:39 (edited: 2018-04-21 23:17:39)</cite></p>
        <p>Quick-n-dirty house rule: cross off the Animal Companion and give the ranger a custom move instead. <br />Very very lazy house rule: make them choose one from the &quot;levels 2-5 list instead.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/108131264929529993281_photo.jpg'> Lester Ward</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-04-22 00:09:09 (edited: 2018-04-22 00:09:09)</cite></p>
        <p>Version 1.4 of <i>Fourth World</i> my drift of <i>Dungeon World</i> to the setting of <i>Earthdawn</i> has a Scout playbook.<br /><br />The not-yet-released 1.5 will contain a shift to using <i>Perilous Wilds</i>. Among other things, this will change the Scout significantly.<a href="https://divnull.com/blog/2018/fourth-world-1-4-relayout/" data-embed="" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">https://divnull.com/blog/2018/fourth-world-1-4-relayout/</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12tsbgjqyyrv1lwp04cgnsgxuzovvxhmo40k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110164541089160428464_photo.jpg'> Robert Finamore</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-04-22 05:52:09 (edited: 2018-04-22 05:52:09)</cite></p>
        <p>There was a very similar thread posted here two weeks ago.  Linked below is an alternate Ranger playbook I built from Class Warfare.
